intro: Oxydectes lagoensis, commonly known as the Lake Victoria waterwheel, is a unique aquatic plant native to the lakes of East Africa, particularly Lake Victoria. It is characterized by its distinctive whorl of narrow, ribbon-like leaves that radiate from a central stem, resembling a waterwheel. The plant thrives in shallow, freshwater environments with moderate to high light exposure. Its leaves are typically green to bluish-green and can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. Oxydectes lagoensis plays a role in stabilizing aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
